title: Sweet Restaurant Slaw Recipe
description: This sweet coleslaw recipe uses a prepared coleslaw mix tossed with a tangy, flavorful dressing and poppy seeds. Perfect with fried chicken.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Salad Coleslaw Recipes No Mayo Sweet Restaurant Slaw 4.8 (3,310) 2,475 Reviews 117 Photos This sweet coleslaw recipe tastes like the slaw served at popular fried chicken or fish restaurants. It's excellent with burgers or on top of BBQ pork sandwiches, too! Submitted by Sandi Gregory Johnson Updated on June 20, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 117 117 117 117 Prep Time: 15 mins Additional Time: 2 hrs Total Time: 2 hrs 15 mins Servings: 8 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 8 servings 1 (16 ounce) bag coleslaw mix 2 tablespoons diced onion ⅔ cup creamy salad dressing (such as Miracle Whip) ½ cup white sugar 3 tablespoons vegetable oil 1 tablespoon white vinegar ½ teaspoon poppy seeds ¼ teaspoon salt Directions Gather the ingredients. Combine coleslaw mix and onion in a large bowl. Whisk salad dressing, sugar, vegetable oil, vinegar, poppy seeds, and salt together in a medium bowl until blended. Pour dressing over coleslaw mixture and toss to coat. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving. I Made It Print 4,479 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 200 Calories 12g Fat 23g Carbs 1g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 8 Calories 200 % Daily Value * Total Fat 12g 15% Saturated Fat 2g 9% Cholesterol 11mg 4% Sodium 253mg 11% Total Carbohydrate 23g 8% Dietary Fiber 1g 3% Total Sugars 15g Protein 1g 2% Vitamin C 19mg 21% Calcium 29mg 2% Iron 0mg 2% Potassium 108mg 2% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Sweet Restaurant Slaw 01 of 117 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 117 Photo by  Jay 08/12/2023 I used half the sugar and it was still pretty sweet. Substituted celery seed for the poppy seed, much improved. A twist of lemon just before serving brightened it up quite a bit. I didn’t add the oil at all. Not necessary. Will make again, but maybe a little less sugar and will definitely keep the other changes. 03 of 117 Photo by  andrew skeen 08/06/2021 04 of 117 Photo by  TLG 07/05/2021 It’s so hard to find good Cole slaw in restaurants or homemade. This recipe is delicious! 05 of 117 Photo by  ritchminer 05/31/2021 06 of 117 Photo by  S White 05/31/2021 07 of 117 Photo by  Debby Longley 04/23/2021 I make this coleslaw to go along with fish and French fried potatoes in the air fryer, almost every Friday. I come from Milwaukee, and Friday is fish fry day, so here in Arizona, I get my taste buds satisfied, yummy 08 of 117 Photo by  Azsteve 03/25/2021 09 of 117 Photo by  Betty Dickson 12/24/2020 Regardless of others opinion that it is too sweet, I think they forgot to read the title/name of the recipe, I think this is the best coleslaw recipe I have come across and I have been making slaw for about 40 years. It has been my go to ever since I first came across this recipe. My other half is very picky about his slaw sauce and even he loves this one. I do use sweet onion and my mini food processor to pulverize it very well and mix everything together. 10 of 117 Photo by  KathyIn WV 12/15/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Southern Coleslaw with Mayo 24 Ratings Picnic Marinated Summer Slaw 55 Ratings Sassy Freezer Slaw 27 Ratings 12-Second Coleslaw 18 Ratings Summer Cabbage Salad 10 Ratings Red BBQ Slaw 57 Ratings Easy Apple Slaw 774 Ratings Asian Coleslaw Light 46 Ratings Curtido (El Salvadoran Cabbage Salad) 35 Ratings Brookville Hotel Sweet and Sour Coleslaw 49 Ratings Thornehedge Peach Slaw 15 Ratings Tri-Color Slaw with Lime Dressing 9 Ratings Bayou's Mardi Gras Slaw 17 Ratings Jayme's Coleslaw 111 Ratings Cabbage and Broccoli Slaw with Vinegar Dressing 2 Ratings Texas Coleslaw 125 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Sandi Gregory Johnson
instructions: Gather the ingredients.;Combine coleslaw mix and onion in a large bowl.;Whisk salad dressing, sugar, vegetable oil, vinegar, poppy seeds, and salt together in a medium bowl until blended.;Pour dressing over coleslaw mixture and toss to coat. Chill for at least 2 hours before serving.
